So I figured it was about time we did.‚Äù ‚ÄúYou spent sixteen hundred dollars,‚Äù Eddie reminds her. entry.title: You Never Know What You Have
entry.summary:
Author: Great_Shark_Lamia

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,995Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 879

Summary: Feeling excluded from the 118 in the aftermath of the truck bombing, Buck strives to make himself a life outside of work. It helps that he already has a group of friends, a new house, two dogs‚Ä¶and two foster kids.But hurt feelings over the lawsuit fade to regret when Buck chooses himself over his station. It might just be the push Eddie needs to let go of his misplaced anger.

Summary: The 118 finally learn why Buck is the way he is. Their theory of a cult or a conversion camp was way off. Somehow, though, the reality of being a demi-god isn‚Äôt much better. Buck thought they‚Äôd be happier to learn he wasn‚Äôt part of a cult. **** (i.e. The 118 all struggle with the revelation in different ways. Bobby crashes out learning the Gods exist, Athena‚Äôs still wanting justice for Buck‚Äôs dead childhood and if Eddie was worried about Anna being a nun, he has no idea how to cope with the literal son of a deity.) **** Part of a series Hearth and Home, Buck is a demi-god, blessed by Hestia.

entry.title: By a Thread
entry.summary:
Author: walkslowlyandbowoften

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,384Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 6

Summary: Whenever Eddie pictured Buck in his mind‚Äôs eye, it was a snapshot of a time they‚Äôd gone to the beach all together, sometime before the tsunami had ruined that for everyone. Eddie was in the passenger seat of Buck‚Äôs jeep. Chris was in the back. Buck was driving, and the sunlight was setting his curls on fire, and he was laughing at something Chris had said. He was in an LAFD tank top that Eddie hadn‚Äôt seen since that day. Eddie‚Äôs phone had been tucked away in the beach bag, or else he would have snapped a picture to hang next to the others on his fridge. Buck, looking so much like himself in those days, before the added weight of everything that had happened since. ---- Buck and Eddie are just beginning to get back into the rhythm of their lives when a call goes disastrously wrong. While Buck's life hangs in the balance, Eddie does some reflecting. Set sometime after Season 8, but for the purposes of this fic I'm not following Season 9 very closely.

entry.title: love, at the worst
entry.summary:
Author: greyspilot

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,022Chapters: 3/12Kudos: 94

Summary: When Eddie came back to L.A. from Texas, Buck knew he would have to move out of Eddie's house, eventually. That had always been the plan; it was always going to be temporary, but Eddie didn't ask, so Buck didn't offer. One night, after a particularly long shift when they were both half-dead on their feet, they collapsed onto the bed together. All they did that night was sleep, but it continued every night after. They didn't talk about it, and Buck thinks that should've been his first warning sign.Or: the Wishbone fic

entry.title: Leaving and Growing Up
entry.summary:
Author: ratking_withnotail

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 227,190Chapters: 18/?Kudos: 1,013

Summary: Percy Jackson was excited‚Äîgenuinely excited‚Äîfor the first time in what felt like years. A new city. A new name. A new face, even. The golden hair, the pale blue eyes, the tattoos that traced his skin like constellations‚Äînone of it screamed ‚ÄúPercy Jackson‚Äù anymore. He was Evan Buckley now, or just Buck, depending on who asked. He‚Äôd keep busy‚Äîphysically exhausted, mentally occupied, emotionally detached. That was the key. No attachments. No friendships. No relationships. No vulnerability. He‚Äôd learned the hard way that getting close to people only ended in pain. Either they died, betrayed him, or saw the legend behind the name and stopped seeing him altogether. Unfortunately, he hadn‚Äôt planned on the 118.

entry.title: some things stay
entry.summary:
Author: literalmetaphor

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,493Chapters: 4/13Kudos: 80

Summary: ‚ÄúYou gotta be pretty desperate to take a job like this, especially with a kid.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy‚Äôs that?‚Äù Eddie‚Äôs face flickers through a dozen almost-expression, like hail against a window pane, never quite breaking through. Buck ticks the reason off on his fingers. ‚ÄúYou got a ghost story looming over everything. No civilization for miles. The place is old and dark and, well, let‚Äôs be honest‚Äîcreepy. The proprietor is an obvious drunk. That enough for you?‚Äù Eddie scoffs. ‚ÄúYou forgot to mention the incredibly off-putting gardener.‚Äù Buck definitely does not smile. ‚ÄúThat too.‚Äù Then, ‚ÄúSo, I figure there‚Äôs something equally wrong with you.‚Äù -- A loose Bly Manor AU.

entry.title: The Lazy Astronomer
entry.summary:
Author: vinimental

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,114Chapters: 6/15Kudos: 16

Summary: Eddie‚Äôs life is fine, until a stranger asks him what he wants from it and he realises he hasn‚Äôt let himself answer that question in years. So he starts looking for what he‚Äôs been missing and rebuilding what‚Äôs been neglected. Buck finds a safe place in an old astronomy tower, where the nights feel discreet enough to listen to the deepest most vulnerable parts of him. He notices Eddie changing, and it feels like hope, which is exactly the problem. But the universe is determined. It gives them sunsets, clear skies, meteor showers, and Eddie learns that the answer has been on its way to him for a long time.

entry.title: Texas Sun
entry.summary:
Author: noflamystique

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,367Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 83

Summary: He exhaled slowly, eyes drifting to the window where a light dusting of snow fell in the early morning light‚Äîbarely enough to stick. It didn‚Äôt look nearly severe enough to justify four days of travel purgatory. ‚ÄúSo basically,‚Äù Eddie groaned, ‚Äúwe‚Äôre stuck.‚Äù Buck shrugged. ‚ÄúWe could always rent a car.‚Äù ‚ÄúAnd drive to California?‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy not?‚Äù Buck said. ‚ÄúYou know I hate flying.‚Äù Eddie did know that. There was little he didn't know about Buck. - Or: Buck and Eddie set off on an unplanned cross-country road trip after their flight back to Los Angeles is grounded by bad weather. Three days on the road, trapped in close quarters with the best friend you are secretly in love with‚Äîwho also seems to be pulling away from you‚Äîshould be manageable. Totally manageable. What could possibly go wrong?
